Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

11/09/2021 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
ALLEGATION:
Agency worker disclosed private information to youth placed at facility regarding
another youth placed there which has had a negative impact regarding interactions
between the two youth.
INVESTIGATION:
On 10/25/2021 I received a copy of a complaint allegation submitted through the
DCWL on-line reporting system that stated when Youth A was admitted to her
current placement program, Foster Care Worker (FCW) told her that one of the other
youths living in the same placement had been raped by Youth A’s dad and to not tell
that youth who her dad was. Youth A keeps bringing this up with the other youth to
upset her.
On 10/26/2021 I interviewed Supervisor by phone. She reported that she was aware
of the concern that Youths A & B were living together. She reports she did not have
a good memory and couldn’t recall the specifics, but Supervisor and FCW had a
conversation about the girls being placed together. Supervisor stated that she would
have to ask FCW why/how the decision was made to tell Youth A about Youth B’s
placement at the facility where Youth A was being placed. Supervisor stated FCW
has since told Supervisor that she told Youth A that another youth at the facility
knew her dad and that she had a negative experience with him, so Youth A should
not talk about her dad. Youth A has since been using this information to upset Youth
B resulting in conflicts between the two. Supervisor reported the director of the
facility where the youth are placed stated during a meeting with FCW and Supervisor
that she was concerned that FCW had told Youth A about Youth B. Supervisor did
not have any concerns with FCW’s statements to Youth A and does not believe
FCW would violate either girl’s confidentiality.
On 10/27/2021 I interviewed Youth A by phone. Youth A stated FCW did not tell her
anything about any of the other youth placed at the facility. Youth A reported she did
not know Youth B or anything about her prior to meeting her at the facility. She
stated she and Youth B were fighting a lot, but now they get along. She stated
initially, she would try to talk to Youth B, but Youth B would ignore her. She stated
she would argue with Youth B about “regular stuff, nothing specific.”
On 10/29/2021 I interviewed FCW by phone. FCW reported Youth B has claimed
she was raped by a man who was Youth A’s father prior to his rights being
terminated in 2017. She reported Youth B is pregnant and was placed in a mother-
baby program. Youth A was in need of a shelter placement and was placed in a
shelter bed in the same facility in which Youth B was placed. FCW stated prior to
bringing Youth A to the facility, FCW, Supervisor, and Director had a conversation
and decided to let the girls know about one another in hopes of avoiding an unsafe
situation. She reported this meeting took place on the date Youth A was placed.
FCW stated she told Youth A there was another youth at the facility who knows
3

Youth A’s dad and had a negative issue with him. FCW stated Youth A responded
by stating that Youth A and the other youth would have something in common
because they both hate her dad. FCW stated there were 5-6 girls at the home, and
she did not give Youth A Youth B’s name. FCW stated she told Youth B, Youth A’s
name and who Youth A’s dad was. She again stated the decision to do so was made
with Supervisor and Director.
On 11/9/2021 I interviewed Director via Teams during which I discussed my
preliminary findings. Director stated Youth A had been AWOL and upon her return,
the agency staff were seeking shelter placement. The Residential Placement Unit
(RPU) had identified a shelter in the Detroit area, but FCW reached out to a contact
at the facility where Youth B is placed and asked if they had open shelter beds. She
then contacted the RPU and requested that Youth A be placed at the facility where
Youth B was placed. Director stated that she expressed her concerns about this
placement to FCW and Supervisor due to the Youth B alleging that she had been
trading sex for drugs from the man who was Youth A’s father prior to his rights being
terminated and that Youth B alleged that he was the father of the child with whom
she is currently pregnant. Director denied ever having a conversation with
Supervisor or FCW about talking to the youth about one another. She stated she
had not heard anything about this concern until she was informed of the complaint
allegation received by Division of Child Welfare Licensing. She stated that she is
extremely concerned that a decision was made to violate confidentiality of both
youth and that this decision has resulted in conflict between the youth.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12211 Privacy safeguard.
(1) An agency shall safeguard the privacy of a child and
his or her family.
ANALYSIS: FCW told two youth identifying and confidential information
about one another.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
